meanings.definition: A former monetary unit of Brazil.
meanings.sent1: In the past, you could buy many things with cruzados.
meanings.sent2: The cruzados were used as currency in Brazil before the real.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to have a treasure hunt with cruzados buried in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like finding a pile of cruzados in an old jacket pocket.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the coins clinking together was the sound of cruzados changing hands.

meanings.definition: A group of people who have banded together for a common purpose.
meanings.sent1: The cruzados worked together to clean up the park.
meanings.sent2: The cruzados organized a charity event to help those in need.
meanings.sent3: The cruzados decided to dress up as superheroes for the school play.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was a strong bond, like the unity of cruzados in battle.
meanings.sent5: The cruzados stood shoulder to shoulder, ready to face any challenge together.
